Hi Adam,

Coincidentally, I've been investigating the same "too many open files" 
error in our crawl projects. Based on what I've found so far, it appears 
Heritrix hit per-process maximum of open file descriptors (1024 in our 
case). Following is what I learned from monitoring 5 hour test crawl 
(Heritrix 3) - probably the something similar must be happening in your 
crawl project, too.

Heritrix 3 has ~80 always-open file descriptors for JARs, log files, 
ARC/WARCs, BDB and listening sockets.

Each active crawling thread can open up to 3 file descriptors at one 
time for fetching and recording HTTP request/response. Our crawler is 
configured with max 200 threads, so there can be up to 600 open file 
descriptors at one time, but usually much less than that (max 318 in our 
case).

In addition to total 400 open fds above, there are other 4 kinds of file 
descriptors, which reached 400 in total during the test. Now it is 
pretty close to per-process limit of 1024.

One of "additional" open descriptors is UDP socket for DNS query. I saw 
max 75 sockets open at one time. If DNS server gets overloaded and slows 
down, there could be more.

Also as crawl job proceed, BDB gets bigger and BDB seems to keep more 
database files open.

Summing up, with following factors combined, Heritrix could run out of 
file descriptors and start failing severely:

- many threads
- shallow crawl on many web sites (such crawl can go very fast, too)
- long-running crawl
- slow DNS queries

Probably crawling with less threads is the easiest (but not so reliable) 
way to prevent this problem, but Heritrix could do a kind of throttling 
by limiting the number of concurrent DNS queries.

Kenji @ Internet Archive

> I am working on domain crawl and I have encounter few strange
> problems. First of all, the crawl has some rapid slowdown (ten times
> slower). This was caused by managing (or comparing) cookies. Well, we
> have decided that disabling cookies for bulk crawl is not big issue.
> After few days, when 4 TB was harvested, heritrix threw too many open
> files exception. I tried to recover, but all my attempts failed. I
> restarted heritrix, build new job based on the old one. Lower the
> toethreads to 250 and started. This order xml is quite the same as I
> used last year for crawling 9.5 TB. After two and half days with 1TB
> crawled heritrix suddenly stop with exception threw on all threads. I
> have attached the exception in the bottom. The limit on the open files
> in the system is set to more than one million. Frankly, I am not sure
> how to track down this problem. Especially when this setting was
> working last year (probably on 1.14.3).
